name: Dr. Chrispin Chaguza
description: My research uses high-throughput sequencing approaches to understand the epidemiology, evolution and genetics of bacterial phenotypes primarily in clinically-significant pathogens.

name: Dr. Christine J. Boinett
description: I am involved in developing, managing and delivering bioinformatics training for our JUNO and GPS2 project partners.

name: Dr. Dorota Jamrozy
description: I coordinate the JUNO project and study genomics and evolution of Group B *Streptococcus*.

name: Dr. Felix Dube
description: My interest is in analysing microbial populations (with a focus on *Streptococcus pneumoniae*) to understand the epidemiology and spread of antimicrobial resistance.

name: Gareth Peat
description: I am involved in developing the software and infrastructure for the JUNO project.

name: Gerry Tonkin-HIll
description: I study within-host evolution and transmission in *Streptococcus pneumoniae* as well as  developing statistical and bioinformatics methods for microbial genomics.

name: Neil MacAlasdair
description: I study recombination and its effects on evolution in *Neisseria meningitidis* and how this affects various populations.

name: Dr. Stephanie Wai-U Lo
description: I oversee the Global Pneumococcal Sequencing Project by setting overall scientific strategy, communicating with collaborators, and delivering outputs through publications.

name: Uzma Basit Khan
description: I study antibiotic resistance mechanisms, recombination, mobile genetic elements and transmission in *Streptococcus agalactiae* to comprehend bacterial adaptation and evolution.
